contentrichtext.text: N.B. QTLS is a status, not a 'License to Practice'. In September 2007 the [[UK Government]] introduced reforms to the [[training]] and qualifications of all teachers, tutors, trainers, lecturers and instructors working in the post-compulsory education and training sector (sometimes referred to as the [[lifelong learning]] sector). However the regulations requiring all FE teachers etc. to be members of IfL were repealed through revocation with effect from 1 September 2012 and membership of IfL is no longer required. ==Gaining QTLS== Although no longer required since September 2012, QTLS is still offered by IfL for a fee of Â£485. In order to obtain QTLS, the candidate is required to register with the [[Institute for Learning]], undertake and record annual [[Continuing Professional Development]] (CPD) and complete IfL's 'professional formation process'. ==See also== * [[Qualified Teacher Status|Qualified Teacher Status (QTS)]] ==External links== * [http://www.lluk.org/ittreforms/index.htm Lifelong Learning UK] * [http://www.ifl.ac.uk/ Institute for Learning] [[Category:Teacher associations based in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Teacher training]]
